content: how can i get files from a remote server

You can use the `scp` command to copy files from a remote server. Here's an example:

```
scp username@remote:/path/to/remote/file /path/to/local/destination
```

Replace `username` with your username on the remote server, `remote` with the hostname or IP address of the remote server, `/path/to/remote/file` with the path to the file on the remote server, and `/path/to/local/destination` with the path to the local directory where you want to save the file.
